alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 5:42PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL SOMERSET COUNTY THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Somerset, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Somerset, Windber, Berlin, Friedens, Boswell, Davidsville, Central City, Jerome, Acosta, Ogletown, Jennerstown, Hooversville, Indian Lake, Stoystown, Shanksville, Benson, New Baltimore, Seven Springs, Laurel Mountain State Park and Flight 93 National Memorial. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central Pennsylvania.
